clinical_study.brief_title: PEG-rhG-CSF in Patients With Breast Cancer Receiving Chemotherapy to Prevent Neutropenia
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-center, Open-label,Single Arm Phase IV Clinical Trial of Efficacy and Safety of PEG-rhG-CSF in Preventing Neutropenia in Patients With Breast Cancer Receiving Chemotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to estimate the efficacy and safety of PEG-rhG-CSF in patients with breast cancer receiving chemotherapy.

primary_outcome.measure: the occurrence rate of the adverse events that are related to treatment during four consecutive cycles chemotherapy
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 30 days after the patient study completion

primary_outcome.measure: the severity of the adverse events that are related to treatment during four consecutive cycles chemotherapy
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 30 days after the patient study completion

secondary_outcome.measure: the occurrence rate of III/ IV neutropenia during the whole chemotherapy process
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through the study completion,an average of 5 months

arm_group.description: patients received a single dose of 100 ug/kg of PEG-rhG-CSF(pegfilgrastim), on the basis of actual body weight, as a single subcutaneous injection on day 3 after chemotherapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with age between 18 and 70 years
- diagnosis of breast cancer patients who need to receive multi-cycle chemotherapy
- grade III/IV neutropenia after chemotherapy

- life expectancy of at least 3 months

Exclusion Criteria:
- Have accepted any other drug related clinical trial within 4 weeks before anticipated
- uncontrolled infection
- pregnancy
- Other situations that investigators consider as contra-indication for this study
